Saparivāriya’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,
the world’s chief, the bull of men,
like a mass of flames burning,
the Awakened One attained final Nibbāna.
And when the Great Hero had Nibbāna’d,
a vast memorial was made;
From afar they attended on it,
the supreme relic house.
With a confident mind, joyful,
I made a moon-like altar;
The memorial’s top was seen,
fitting for the memorial then.
When I was reborn in existence,
among the gods and then humans,
I didn’t see anything equal to it,
this is the fruit of my past deeds.
For five hundred and ten aeons,
eight people were here;
All of them had the same name,
wheel-turning monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical insights …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the venerable Saparivāriya recited these verses.
